title: The Ultimate Guide for Stopping Spam Email in Gmail

steps.title: Stop using your Gmail account to create new accounts.
steps.content: Stop using your Gmail account to create new accounts. When you use Gmail to create accounts or log-ins into other websites, be careful not to let those websites send emails to your Gmail inbox. If you trust the website and want updates from it, it is okay to let that website send emails. However, if you don't completely trust a website, make sure the checkbox that says "allow us to send updates" is unchecked when you sign up. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Stop spam emails with filters.
steps.content: Stop spam emails with filters . This is the easiest way to stop spam emails. If you are feeling that a certain website or sender is spamming your inbox, you can set up a filter, which will automatically flag emails and delete them automatically. Use the following steps to do so: [2] X Research source This option is only available while accessing Gmail through a web browser. It is not currently available for the Gmail mobile app.

steps.title: Click the icon that resembles three slider bars.
steps.content: Click the icon that resembles three slider bars. It's to the right of the search bar at the top of the page. A window that allows you to specify your search criteria will appear.

steps.title: Enter your search criteria.
steps.content: Enter your search criteria. You can enter email addresses next to "From." You can also specify a subject, or words an email has or doesn't have. For example, if you want to block spam, the best thing to do is enter email addresses or subjects that you know are spam. [3] X Research source If you want to check that your search has worked correctly, click the Search button. Clicking the down arrow again will bring the window back with the same search criteria you entered.

steps.title: Click Create Filter.
steps.content: Click Create Filter . It's at the bottom of the Search menu. This will create a new filter based on your search criteria. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Choose the action you'd like for these messages.
steps.content: Choose the action you'd like for these messages. Do this by checking the appropriate box. For example, if you want to automatically delete spam, click the checkbox next to "Delete It" to delete emails that fit your search criteria.

steps.title: Click Create Filter.
steps.content: Click Create Filter . It's the blue button in the lower-right corner. This creates a new filter for your emails. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Mark the unwanted emails from particular websites or sender.
steps.content: Mark the unwanted emails from particular websites or sender. To do so, click the checkbox next to the emails you want to remove to select them. If you are using the mobile app, tap and hold the emails you want to delete. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Stop Spam" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Stop Spam" icon. It's the icon that resembles a stop sign at the top of the page. This marks the emails as spam and moves them to your spam folder. This also reports the emails as spam. If you are using the mobile app, tap the icon that resembles three dots in the upper-right corner. Then tap Report spam . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click or tap the Spam folder.
steps.content: Click or tap the Spam folder. It's in the menu to the left. If you do not see the Spam folder, click More at the bottom of the list of inboxes and then scroll down to the Spam folder. [8] X Research source If you are using the mobile app, tap the icon that resembles three horizontal lines in the upper-left corner. The tap Spam .

steps.title: Select the messages you'd like to delete.
steps.content: Select the messages you'd like to delete. To do so, click the checkbox next to the messages you would like to delete. If you are using the mobile app, simply tap and hold the messages you want to delete. [9] X Research source Alternatively, you can click Delete all spam messages now at the top or your browser page, or tap Empty spam now at the top of the mobile app to instantly delete all Spam messages .

steps.title: Click Delete forever or tap .
steps.content: Click Delete forever or tap . It's at the top of the page. If you are using a desktop computer, click Delete forever to delete all selected emails. If you are using the mobile app, tap the icon that resembles a trashcan at the top of the page. [10] X Research source Gmail will learn that some messages are spam and treat them as such in future. However, it doesn't always get it right; unopened emails that you have been meaning to get around to but then delete in a clean-up without actually wanting to unsubscribe can end up being treated as spam. You'll need to retrieve such emails from the Spam folder so that Gmail learns to leave them alone again.

steps.title: Sort your emails to help you prioritize what you deal with.
steps.content: Sort your emails to help you prioritize what you deal with. Gmail has three categories of mails sorted for the incoming mails such as Primary , Social , and Promotion . You can add more categories or combine them into one category. Creating Labels will help you to determine which mail is spam and which mail is important.

steps.title: Add Labels
steps.content: Add Labels in the settings. This option is only available when accessing Gmail through a web browser. This option is not available on the Android's Gmail app. Use the following steps to create labels: [11] X Research source Click the Gear icon in the upper-right corner. Click See all settings . Click the Labels tab at the top of the page. Click Create New Label towards the bottom of the menu. Enter the name of the new label. Click Create .

steps.title: Move emails to different inboxes or labels.
steps.content: Move emails to different inboxes or labels. To do so, simply click the checkboxes next to the emails you want to move to a specific inbox or label. Then click and drag any one of the messages to the inbox or label to the left. This moves all emails to the inbox. [12] X Research source Alternatively, you can create a new filter that will move emails from the sender or with a specific subject to an inbox or label automatically.
